intro: Seseli segetum, commonly known as field sesel, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas, such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a hairy texture. Seseli segetum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions.
